III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Wolverine Center did not provide for the needs, protection, and
supervision of Youth A when he truanted and ingested pills.
Investigation Complainant
I left a phone message for Complainant on 06/27/2023.
Complainant sent Youth A’s documentation and incident reports
for review on 06/27/2023 and did not have additional information.
Youth A
Youth A was not interviewed because he was at Children’s
Hospital of Detroit awaiting psychiatric placement.
Staff person 1
Staff person 1 was not available for an interview on 07/03/2023
and was interviewed on 07/14/2023 by phone. Staff person 1
stated he and Supervisor 1 shadowed Youth A when he truanted
from Wolverine Center on 06/24/2023. Staff person 1 stated Youth
A did not respond to redirection to stop digging through a pile of
disposed items on the side of the road. Staff person 1 stated he
secured a bottle of pills Youth A found, but Youth A found another
bottle of pills and ingested the contents before he or Supervisor 1
could obtain the bottle. Staff person 1 stated law enforcement and
paramedics were called.
Supervisor 1
Supervisor 1 was not interviewed because she is no longer
employed at Wolverine Center. Supervisor 1 wrote an incident
report dated 06/24/2023. It states Youth A ran towards a field
when he saw Supervisor 1, but Staff person 1 continued to
shadow Youth A. It states Youth A did not comply with relationship
support and redirection to return to facility. It states Supervisor 1
returned to facility to pick up a van to use in shadowing Youth A
and upon return saw Staff person 1 running after Youth A, who
had a pill bottle. It states the pill bottle was obtained, but Youth A
picked up another bottle and ingested the contents. It states Youth
A refused to spit out the pills and ran. It states Law enforcement
and paramedics were called and Youth A was transported to
Children’s Hospital of Detroit.
Foster care worker
I spoke with Youth A’s Foster care worker (FCW) on 06/27/2023
by phone. FCW stated Youth A has been at Children’s Hospital of
Detroit since 06/24/2023 waiting for psychiatric placement and
discharged from Wolverine Center on 06/26/2023. FCW stated
Youth A told her that he found the pills and ingested the pills while
he was truant from Wolverine Center. FCW stated Youth A
2

received a charcoal treatment for the unknown ingested pills. I
spoke with FCW on 07/14/2023 by phone. FCW stated a
psychiatric bed was secured for Youth A and he would be
admitted there on 07/14/2023.
Analysis Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1 followed Youth A when he
truanted from Wolverine Center on 06/24/2023. Youth A was
taken and admitted to Children’s Hospital of Detroit on 06/24/2023
after he ingested unknown pills he found while truant. It is found
that Staff person 1 and Supervisor 1 provided for the needs,
protection, and supervision of Youth A.
CONSULTATION
06/24/2023 incident report had words blacked out with circle
spirals. Written errors are to be crossed out with a single
horizontal line through the word(s) and initialed by the writer.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
